content.description: The crux is pulling off the set start. Holds in the middle of the route may be mossy.
Start on the flake and either jam or layback your way up. Nice incut ledges to grab too.
content.location:
Boulder towards the top of the hill, this route is on the inside of the channel/fully of most of the rocks. 

 See Saving Flake for photo. Rightmost line.

content.description: Start on the ledge/rail. The crux is the mantle right after the start.
content.location:
The furthest boulder up hill on the inside of the channel that runs between most of the rocks. This will be the problem furthest left that is above 10 ft.

 Photo on Saving Flake. Leftmost line.

content.description: The crux is in the middle of this fairly easy route. Typically involves tossing up a solid finger lock from some iffy footholds and a crusty side pull. Top out has a nice jug or hand jam.
content.location: On the uphill outside side of the main rock channel. Accessed by staying right at the entrance and following the wall up or walking down along the wall from Hydroxyloxyl.

content.description: Start with your hands on a flake. Do what you can eith your feet but they're just sort of there at the start. Work up through moss coated jugs and flakes.
content.location: The nice thick bodied boulder in the middle, one of the first climbable rocks you'll encounter from the creek.

content.description: Start with your arms wide on a balancey foothold and slap your way to the top.
content.location: On thesouth side, outside of the channel, side of the rocks. Opposite side of the hard backed cover boulder.

content.description:
Start on a crimp and work the flake.

 The crux is the mantle in the middle of the route. As soon as you pull it though it's an easy top.
content.location: The boulder towards the top of the hill, on the inside of the channel/fully that runs between the rocks.

content.description: Avoid the slab boulder near the start. Layback up the chunky sidepull. Step high, watch your footing rocks pop on this one, and move on up.
content.location: Left of Hydroxyloxyl on the outside of the main channel.

content.description: Start with your hands on a diagonal rail, left foot low, and utilize a toehook to keep from twisting if you want. Continue up left on good holds. Some interesting footholds can be used. The crux is moving off the start and keeping yourself from barndooring.
content.location: Around the corner from Splayed Alive.

content.description: Start out at the base of this high ball and follow an intermittent crack/flake up. Crux comes in the middle where holds are sparse. Sink your hands in some messy side pulls and pray they don't pop. Top out is a little sketchy because you have to down climb the back side. Walk or shimmy down the spine until you see some good holds to lower on. Spectacular view from the top.
content.location: Towards the top there is a taller thin boulder. Walk outside of the channel/fully, on the northernish side, and find the base.

content.description: Start out with your hands on the pinch flake, feet under the overhang. Reach up and pull through some crimps to the top. Crux is going for the top hold, it's a blank section of the wall and requires balancey moves, trusting some iffy crimps, or a dyno. Crimps may pop off at any time so be wary.
content.location:
Find the thicker boulder up from the creek. On the inside of the channel/gully of most of the rocks.

 Photo on Tortilla Chip Verde, rightmost line.

content.description: Variation of the Hardback problem. Trend left by utilizing a far reaching sidepull or undercling. Get your body tension right before running it up to the juggy topout.
content.location: Shares a start with Hardback cover. Heads towards Chip Verde.

content.description: Sit start to Splayed Alive. Start with your hands on an undercling rail just above the Splayed's foot start. Feet tucked up under the overhang. Work your way up from there to the Splayed's starting holds and continue. Adds a few moves with some fun tension.

The fins proper has 4 or 5 good thin boulders with problems ranging from easy to moderate. It is mostly conglomerate rock. Pretty rough to the touch. This area is on the border of park property. There are some boulders downhill from this area too, but they are on private property.
